description: Array read by diagonals: T(h,k)=number of paths consisting of steps from (0,0) to (h,k) such that each step has length 1 directed up or right and no up-step crosses the line y=2x/3. (Thus a path crosses the line only at lattice points and on right-steps.).
comments: T is the transpose of the array in A125778.
links: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals n = 0..140, flattened
maple: T:= proc(h, k) option remember;      `if`([h, k]=[0, 0], 1, `if`(h<0 or k<0, 0, T(h-1, k)+      `if`(3*k>2*h and 3*(k-1)<2*h, 0, T(h, k-1))))    end:seq(seq(T(h,d-h), h=0..d), d=0..20); # _Alois P. Heinz_, Apr 04 2012
mathematica: T[h_, k_] :=  T[h, k] = If[{h, k} == {0, 0}, 1, If[h<0 || k<0, 0, T[h-1, k]+If[3*k > 2*h && 3*(k-1) < 2*h, 0, T[h, k-1]]]]; Table[Table[T[h, d-h], {h, 0, d}], {d, 0, 20}] // Flatten (* _Jean-FranÃ§ois Alcover_, Mar 03 2014, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
author: _Clark Kimberling_. Definition revised Dec 08 2006
